ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course served as a fantastic introduction to Italian. I can now converse very basically and I have developed the foundational skills to start learning a new language. I've learnt a lot about Italian culture and made connections through various programmes offered.
I have a basic knowledge of conversational Italian and grammar.

Since taking this course I've gained the knowledge of how to learn a language right from the ground up and how to build and understanding of the way in which language fits together to create something fluent. In addition to this I've learnt a lot about Italian culture through either informative videos, both assigned and in class and also through reading that we have done in class through group discussion.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Overall, the course and especially the instructor were brilliant. With the vast amount of material to learn, it did at times seem like the pace was slightly challenging, and that there wasn't an ideal amount of time for reflection and conversation. Nevertheless, this is to be expected; the instructor was amazing and there were alternative means to practice orally such as online exchanges and tutors.
Deborah is an incredibly engaging instructor and makes sure that all the students can participate.

I really like the Asynchronous elements of this course, as I think it really gives the students the chance to catch up and explore the language in their own time and to explore their interests that may have been sparked within the classroom further. In addition to this the amount of group-work that was used in the course means that I gained a good grasp of both speaking and listening / understanding the language - a better understanding of what Italian interactions would actually be like. As far as weaknesses are concerned I think that with any L1 language course it is quite vocabulary and grammar heavy, so maybe filling some of it with a bit more Italian culture would diversify the knowledge with which the students went onto L2 with

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. As someone who has learnt 3 languages before from scratch, this class does an unbelievable job to push you closer to fluency even at such a low level. The balance of a casual learning environment with rigour made me excited to go to class every day. Moreover, you make many friends in such a small seminar setting. If you want a fun, insightful language learning experience with just the right amount of challenge, I cannot recommend the course more.
Yes. The workload is not too high and I feel like I was able to learn a lot.

I would recommend this course to another student at Yale as it was one which was very enjoyable and with a manageable workload, but also a course that is very engaging and whilst still intellectually stimulating it is a course that encourages interaction in the classroom which I found to be really enjoyable.
